Thailand will urgently promulgate a law
banning the recreational use of marijuana, this is
the statement made by the Thai health minister
in
Thailand on February 6, the bill
will be passed.  proposed at the internal meeting
next week.
Before that, Thai Prime Minister
Strovin had also frequently spoken out
against the recreational use of marijuana, only
accepting the use of this substance for
medical purposes.  Recreational marijuana
can make drug problems
wider than Thai law once stipulated that
people carrying marijuana could be
sentenced to 10 years in prison and have to pay a
huge fine. However, since 2018, this country
has allowed  Allowing the use of cannabis for medical purposes
in order to make a profit in this field.
Thailand removed cannabis from the list of
banned substances in June 2022, causing
hundreds of stores selling this substance to
spring up across Thailand.  Especially in
Bangkok, but this rapid development has
caused many people to call on
Thai authorities to tighten marijuana control laws.

since 1803 that two different species of cicadas

reason is because of the time spent in the soil of the
two species of cicadas.  This is 13 years and 17

17 years before it emerges to the surface and
becomes a second melanophore called brus.
ch lives in the southeastern United States. The larvae

is essentially a reconstructed version
thanks to 3D printing technology and other modern techniques of the
about 11 m high statue of Emperor Constantin placed in the Yangtze
Palace.  The capitoline statue has been recreated in the exact same
size as the original statue dating back to the
fourth century. The original statue was completely destroyed
due to war and chaos.
We collected fragments of the original statue at the
level of every mm detail.  Then we created a
digital model and then converted the
digital data into physical data at a scale of 11
after studying the fragments of the
original statue collected from the 15th century to the
mid-20th century.  Taking
photos to create a 3D model and rebuilding the
statue. This entire restoration process
lasted 10 months. In addition to 3D printing technology, the
team also used marble powder, leaves,
plastic and rubber to shape and
decorate the exterior.  of the statue, they also
created an aluminum frame to support and bear the
force inside. Based on the remaining pieces and
traces, we placed each
piece in its correct position, we

people to report the situation of vehicles carrying
people exceeding the prescribed number.
Ho Chi Minh City police
said today that they have  Detected and fined the Duong
Nam passenger bus carrying more than the prescribed number of people
on February 6. This passenger bus
departed from Binh Duong bus station to
An Giang Province. According to the registration information, the vehicle
was allowed to carry 40 people, but upon
inspection,  The authorities discovered up
to 64 passengers. The authorities
issued a record of fine of 12 million VND
for the bus driver. At the same time, the
relevant bus company was forced to transfer the passengers
to another vehicle in accordance with regulations.
For example, the city police advise
people when booking tickets and picking up buses to
choose reputable bus companies. If you detect a
situation where the bus has oversold tickets and crams
passengers, you can call the phone number
displayed on the screen.
Police will receive, verify and quickly
handle in accordance with the
law from 1:00 p.m. this afternoon.

Tien Giang province. The fire was so big that it

areas.  The fire was basically controlled in the surrounding area until about 9 p.m.
Although it did not

Early this morning, a boat was

Border guards of Ben Tre province mobilized

was sunk by waves on the Ham River,
about 2.5 km away from Ba Hien. At this time,
there were three crew members on the boat, up to 1 person.  :45 min The

to shore safely. One person is still missing.
The units are continuing to coordinate to
search for the remaining victims.
